job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.description: About MazeMaze is a Series A funded startup building the future of rapid testing for modern teams. We're backed by some of the world's best funds and have an extensive advisory network.We're on a mission to empower modern teams to build better user experiences by testing and learning rapidly with real users. To do this, we've partnered with the world's biggest design tools, including Adobe XD, Figma, InVision, Sketch, and Marvel. We power over 40,000 brands globally, including IBM, Logitech, Pipedrive, Uber, Greenpeace, and Braze.We're a fully remote team working across 23 countries. You'll be joining a passionate team whose resumes include Canva, Figma, GitLab, Google, InVision, Typeform and Zendesk.What you will doAs a part of the Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team you will work to build design and architect the infrastructure of Maze. Your day-to-day will be working to ensure our platform applications are reliable and healthy.Your scope will be as follow :ResponsibilitiesBuild, design, deploy, maintain and lead the implementation of Cloud solutions on AWS infrastructureSupervise infrastructure including proactive capacity management and replication strategiesCollaborate with developers, designers and testing specialists to deliver fully automated Cloud solutionDeploy, configure, manage, and maintain technical infrastructure.Troubleshoot and resolve technical operational issues related to the AWS Cloud InfrastructureDefine and document best practices and strategies regarding application deployment and infrastructure maintenanceUsing best practices to migrate our infrastructure with little or zero downtime to a highly available, scalable oneDeploying proof of concept (PoC) for new technologiesWork with automation tools to improve performance and deployment proceduresSet up and maintain a monitoring stack that helps to monitor infrastructure 24x7Be part of the on-call rotation schedule and make sure alerts are setup properly on the production environmentTechnologiesHere is our technology stack we use within our teamAWS : S3, CloudFront, Elasticache, EKS, Lambda, ECR, route53, IAMTerraformServerlessKubernetesDockerHelm ChartsDatadog, PrometheusCircleCI/Circle OrbsNode.jsGolangCQRS and Event SourcingMandatory skills are AWS Cloud, Kubernetes. Programming languages required are node.js and golang.Consider this our wish-list. We know there will be great candidates that don't meet every one of these criteriaâif you're passionate about the role and feel that your experience prepares you to do it, we'd love to hear from you.Why Maze is uniqueEarly-stage startup: You will join an early-stage startup with less than 100 employees. This means you'll have the unique opportunity to directly impact success and help shape the future of Maze.Category: We're on a mission to democratize user testing and are truly excited about defining a new space where anyone can test and learn rapidly.Product-market Fit: We already have a strong product-market fit for product designers and a NPS of 60, and we're excited to build on top of this to reach PMF for our new user segments.5x Growth: We're a fast-growing startup and we have big goals! You will have the opportunity to impact Maze's growth and help us achieve the next milestone in our journey.BenefitsUnlimited time offCompany retreats, fully paid by MazeLaptop paid for by MazePaid Family leave: 14 weeks for birth or adoptive parents$850/month in benefits to be used at your discretion. Get the benefits that matter to you with our flexible a-maze-ing benefits!$2,000 remote work setup fund to ensure you can set up a productive work space!Free access to proper mental health care
